alumniOf.name:
NY. He served in the U.S. Air Force from 2000-2007. He is a veteran of Operation Enduring Freedom and received the Joint Service Achievement Medal for his work as a Spanish linguist for the Defense Intelligence Agency in 2005. William graduated from Campbell University in 2007 with a degree in computer science. He earned his J.D. in 2011 from the North Carolina Central University School of Law. His practice areas include immigration law and criminal defense cases. He is licensed and in good standing with the State Bar of North Carolina and a member of the American Immigration Lawyer Association (AILA.) He is a proud member of the Charlotte community and provides compassionate counsel for all his clients.

content.heroSection:
Winston-Salem, NC Immigration Lawyers

The United States of America is a dream land for many people across the globe, and we happen to agree that this country is pretty amazing! So much so that our goal as Winston-Salem immigration lawyers is to help good people come here from overseas and achieve their dreams as fully naturalized American citizens!

The legal team at Vasquez Law Firm has a combined 40 years of experience helping people navigate the complicated legal system that allows for immigration to the U.S. While there are many aspects to love about this country, the barriers of entry can prove very frustrating for people looking to build their new life here. Reach out to us to schedule a free initial consultation and learn how we can help clarify the process and make sure that you are making all of the right moves!

Our Winston-Salem Immigration Lawyers Can Help You With Your Immigration Goals

  • Visas: If you are looking to stay in the U.S. either temporarily or permanently, you will need a visa. There are many types of visas and each one has a specific function and process by which they can be attained. We can help you ensure that you are pursuing the correct visa and that your paperwork is spotless!
  • Green cards: A green card is the first step in the process to naturalization and it allows you to do things in the U.S. like work and help family members come over. In order to procure a green card, you will need sponsorship from a U.S.-based family member or employer. Our Winston-Salem immigration lawyers can help you start the process!
  • Deportation appeals: Removal proceedings can happen for a number of reasons, including an expiration of your visa or green card. Deportation can also be used as a penalty for criminal activity. If you are being subject to removal proceedings, we can help you try to adjust your status in order to bypass the removal, or else we can advise you on how you can legally return to the U.S. at a later date.
  • Adjustment of status: Do you have a visa and want to upgrade to a green card? We can help you! 
  • DACA: The Deferred Action For Childhood Arrivals (DACA) Act allows undocumented children who grew up in the U.S. to have some legal basis in which they can acquire documentation and work in the U.S., as well as be protected from removal proceedings. If you meet the requirements for DACA, we can help you throughout the processes of application and renewal. 
  • Criminal offenses: Removal proceedings can be a consequence of criminal conviction if you are in the U.S. on a visa or green card. We are “crimmigration” lawyers, meaning we have an extensive background in criminal law in addition to immigration. If you are charged with a crime, we can help defend you from your charges and potentially avoid removal proceedings.
  • Naturalization: Naturalization is an equivalent of citizenship, and it is the end goal of many people who are entering the U.S. If it is your dream to live in America, we hope that you will allow us to help you to achieve your dream!

Vasquez Law Firm Can Help You Achieve Your American Dream

If you are facing any of these legal struggles related to immigration, the experienced team at Vasquez Law Firm wants to help you overcome your struggles and realize your dreams. We have helped many good people establish their home in the United States, and we believe we can help you as well! Reach out to schedule a free initial consultation and learn how we can make a difference in your American journey. 

Practice Areas

  • Winston-Salem, NC Auto Accident Lawyers
  • Winston-Salem, NC Immigration Lawyers
  • Winston-Salem, NC Workers’ Comp Lawyers

mainEntity.name: How long does the immigration process take?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration timelines vary greatly depending on your case type. Green card applications can take 8-33 months, while citizenship typically takes 8-12 months. Contact Vasquez Law Firm for a personalized timeline assessment.

mainEntity.name: Do I need an immigration lawyer?

acceptedAnswer.text: While not required, an immigration lawyer significantly improves your chances of success. Immigration law is complex and constantly changing. Our attorneys at Vasquez Law Firm ensure your application is complete and accurate.

mainEntity.name: How much does an immigration lawyer cost in Charlotte?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration attorney fees vary by case complexity. Vasquez Law Firm offers competitive rates and payment plans. Call 1-844-YO-PELEO for a free consultation and fee quote.

## Serving Charlotte and Surrounding Areas
Vasquez Law Firm proudly serves clients throughout Charlotte, Mecklenburg County, and the greater North Carolina area. With offices conveniently located in Charlotte, we're here to help with all your legal needs.


## Why Choose Vasquez Law Firm?
- **Experienced Attorneys**: Over 20 years of combined legal experience
- **Bilingual Services**: We speak English and Spanish
- **Free Consultation**: Call 1-844-YO-PELEO today
- **Proven Results**: Hundreds of satisfied clients
- **24/7 Availability**: We're here when you need us
